info.title: SendGrid Web API
info.description: SendGrid offers a Web API that allows customers to retrieve information about their account such as statistics, bounces, spam reports, unsubscribes, and other information. This API is not RESTful since for most calls both GET and POST HTTP verbs can be used interchangeably, and other verbs are not supported.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Optional date to start counting from.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Optional date to start counting from.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of bounce to count.

get.description: Delete an address from the Block list.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Blocked email address to remove.

get.description: Retrieve a list of Blocks with addresses and response codes, optionally with dates.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Retrieve the timestamp of the Block records. It will return a date in a MySQL timestamp format - YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days in the past for which to retrieve blocks (includes today)

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve blocks

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional field to limit the number of results returned.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve blocks.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

get.description: Delete an address from the Bounce list.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

parameters.name: delete_all
parameters.description: This will delete the bounce list and will not be retrievable.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email bounce address to remove.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Optional date to end deleting from.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Optional date to start deleting from.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Choose the type of bounce to be removed.

get.description: Retrieve a list of bounces with addresses and response codes, optionally with dates.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Retrieve the timestamp of the bounce records. It will return a date in a MySQL timestamp format - YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days in the past for which to retrieve bounces (includes today).

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Optional email addresses to search for.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve bounces.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional field to limit the number of results returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Optional beginning point in the list to retrieve from.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve bounces.

parameters.name: type_of_media
parameters.description: Choose the type of bounce to search for.

get.description: Retrieve the count of invalid emails.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve invalid emails.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve invalid emails.

get.description: Delete an address from the Invalid Email list.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email Invalid Email address to remove

get.description: Retrieve a list of invalid emails with addresses and response codes, optionally with dates.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Retrieve the timestamp of the invalid email records. It will return a date in a MySQL timestamp format - YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days in the past for which to retrieve invalid emails (includes today)

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Optional email addresses to search for.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve invalid emails.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional field to limit the number of results returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Optional beginning point in the list to retrieve from.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve invalid emails.

post.description: SendGrid offers a Web API that allows customers to retrieve information about their account such as statistics, bounces, spam reports, unsubscribes, and other information. This API is not RESTful since for most calls both GET and POST HTTP verbs can be used interchangeably, and other verbs are not supported.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

parameters.name: bcc
parameters.description: This can also be passed in as an array of email addresses for multiple recipients.

parameters.name: cc
parameters.description: This can also be passed in as an array of email addresses for multiple recipients

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Content IDs of the files to be used as inline images. Content IDs should match the cids used in the HTML markup. Ex: content[file1.jpg]=ii_139db99fdb5c3704 would correspond with the HTML.

parameters.name: date_on
parameters.description: Specify the date header of your email. One example: u201cThu, 21 Dec 2000 16:01:07 +0200u201d.

parameters.name: files
parameters.description: Files to be attached. The file contents must be part of the multipart HTTP POST.

parameters.name: fromdate
parameters.description: This is where the email will appear to originate from for your recipient

parameters.name: fromname
parameters.description: This is name appended to the from email field. IE - Your name or company name

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: A collection of key/value pairs in JSON format. Each key represents a header name and the value the header value.

parameters.name: html
parameters.description: The HTML content of your email message.

parameters.name: replyto
parameters.description: Append a reply-to field to your email message

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: The subject of your email

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The plain text content of your email message.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: This can also be passed in as an array, to send to multiple locations. Example: to[]=a@mail.com[]=b@mail.com. Note that recipients passed in this parameter will be visible as part of the message. If you wish to hide the recipients, use the TO parameter in the x-smtpapi header.

parameters.name: toname
parameters.description: Give a name to the recipient. This can also be passed as an array if the to above is an array. Example: toname[]=Alpha[]=Beta.

parameters.name: x-smtpapi
parameters.description: Please review the SMTP API to view documentation on what you can do with the JSON headers

get.description: Retrieve the count of Spam Reports.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve spam reports.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve spam reports.

get.description: Retrieve and delete entries in the Spam Reports list.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Retrieve the timestamp of the spam report records. It will return a date in a MySQL timestamp format - YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days in the past for which to retrieve spam reports (includes today)

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Optional email addresses to search for.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end of the date range for which to retrieve spam reports.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Optional field to limit the number of results returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Optional beginning point in the list to retrieve from.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start of the date range for which to retrieve spam reports.

parameters.name: aggregate
parameters.description: This is used to indicate you are interested in all-time totals

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category for which to retrieve detailed stats

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Number of days in the past to include statistics (Includes today)

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date to look up statistics

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: Retrieve a list of all the categories used in your account.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date to look up statistics

get.description: Advanced Statistics methods provide metrics on the browsers and devices that are opening emails, as well as providing statistics based on geographic location or ISP.

parameters.name: aggregated_by
parameters.description: Aggregate the data by the given period

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Password

parameters.name: api_user
parameters.description: Your SendGrid Username

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Return stats for the given category

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Get stats for each region/state for the given country.
